The average fuel cost across all vehicles is 14.45 cents per mile, or about 23 miles per gallon.
The best selling car of all-time is the Toyota Corolla.
It would take less than a month to get to the moon by car
The U.S. consumes about half of the world’s gasoline.
Ferrari manufactures a maximum of 14 cars a day.
The average consumer spends $400 a year on diagnostics, scheduled maintenance, and tune-ups.
The first windshield wipers were hand-operated.
White is the most popular car color.
The first cars did not have steering wheels. They were operated by a lever.
It takes half an ounce of gas to start a car.
The world’s first speeding ticket was issued in 1902
1 in 4 cars on the UK’s road were made in China
A modern Formula 1 car can drive upside down in a tunnel at 120mph
60 million cars are produced every year
The average car contains over 30,000 unique parts
75% of all cars produced by Rolls Royce are still on the road
The largest speeding fine ever produced was €1,000,000
The world record for removing and replacing a car engine is 42 seconds
The odds of dying in a car accident are around 1 in 5,000
The man who invented cruise control was blind
The highest total mileage clocked by a single car is 2,850,000 million miles
In 1916, 55% of all the cars in the WORLD were Model T Fords.
Porsche’s first car was electric.
South African drivers have the option to install flamethrowers on their cars.
Whale oil was used in some car transmissions until 1973
The Ford F150 is programmed with over 150 million lines of code
U.S. auto production nearly stopped entirely during World War II
Pluto is smaller in diameter than the U.S.
You can make volcanos using water as magma.
The edge of the solar system is 1,000 times farther away than Pluto.
Almost everything on Earth is a rare element.
Jupiter has the biggest ocean of any planet, albeit made of metallic hydrogen.
The hottest planet isn’t closest to the sun
We live inside the sun.
Jupiter has had the same ongoing storm for 300 years and counting.
Neptune experiences wind speeds as fast as 1,600mph!
You can grow as much as 5cm taller in space compared to on Earth.
Venus the second brightest object in the night sky after the Moon.
All planets were named after Roman and Greek gods and goddesses, except the Earth.
Mars has two moons called Phobos and Deimos.
Uranus is the second furthest planet from the Sun.
It takes Uranus roughly 84 years to orbit once around the Sun.
Mercury and Venus are the only 2 planets in our solar system that have no moons.
If a star passes too close to a black hole, it can be torn apart.
The hottest planet in our solar system is Venus.
Our solar system is 4.57 billion years old.
The Milky Way galaxy is 105,700 light-years wide.
There are 79 known moons orbiting Jupiter.
The best-selling mobile phone is the Nokia 1100
In Ads, iPhones are Always Set to 9:41
The term Bluetooth comes from a Nordic king
There is a mobile phone out in space
Android Represents More Than 80% of the OS Market
The first call from a mobile phone was made on April 3, 1973
There is an addiction to mobile phones and it’s called nomophobia
We check our mobile phone about 150 times a day on average
There are already more mobile phones than people in our world
Mobile phones contain many more bacteria than a toilet flush
the first Android phone was T-Mobile G1, aka HTC Dream introduced in the year 2008.
Google was prototyping their mobile software on a device known as the “Sooner“
In the year 2012, Apple sold 340,000 iPhones per day.
The Telephone Exchanges were the first setup in the US and they mentioned ‘Hello’ as the standard way to start a conversation on a phone in their manuals, which was then adopted world wide.
Apple was the first to include the front-facing camera on a smartphone with iPhone 4 in 2010.
iPhone was the first smartphone to feature a successful Facetime Vidoe Calling.
90 percent of the phones in Japan are waterproof.
Nokia 1100 was the only product in the history of electrical gadgets. It sold more than 250 million mobile phones.
In the United Kingdom, more than one million Smartphone people accidentally fall into the toilet every year.
90 percent of the world’s messages are read within 3 minutes of sending.
An average person breathes in around 11,000 litres of air every day.
Your nose and ears continue growing throughout your entire life.
Your sense of smell is around 10,000 times more sensitive than your sense of taste.
The brain uses over a quarter of the oxygen used by the human body.
The brain of an adult human weighs around 3 pounds (1.5 kg). Although it makes up just 2 per cent of the body’s weight, it uses around 20 per cent of its energy.
When listening to music, your heartbeat will sync with the rhythm.
In one year, a human heart would pump enough blood to fill an Olympic size pool.
A large amount of the dust in your home is actually dead skin. Humans shed about 600,000 particles of skin every hour.
As well as having unique fingerprints, humans also have unique tongue prints.
The cornea is the only part of the body with no blood supply – it gets its oxygen directly from the air.
The liver is a serious multi-tasker, carrying out over 500 different roles.
Every day the heart creates enough energy to drive a truck 20 miles.
The average heart beats 80 times a minute! This adds up to around 115,000 times a day, or 42 million times a year!
You’re more likely to have a heart attack on a Monday then on any other day of the week.
There’s a one in three chance that your first heart attack will be your last.
A females heart is smaller than a males by about 25%.
It’s not just your cheeks that turn red and expose your embarrassment when you’re blushing. Your stomach also turns red, but not many people will notice this.
Every 3-4 seconds, around 50,000 cells in your body will die and be replaced by new ones.
It’s scientifically proven that children grow faster in the spring.
After a long day at work, you will be around 8mm shorter than you were in the morning.
Three dogs survived the Titanic sinking
A Bloodhound’s sense of smell can be used as evidence in court
Basenji dogs don’t bark, they yodel
A Greyhound could beat a Cheetah in a long distance race
30% of Dalmatians are deaf in one ear
The Saluki is the oldest dog breed
Dogs have three eyelids
Dogs noses are wet to help absorb scent chemicals
Stray dogs in Russia have learned how to ride the complex subway system, and get off at specific stops in search of food.
Your dog can smell your feelings.They can in fact, smell things such as fear. When a human is fearful, they perspire, and a dog is easily able to pick up on this change.
According to Welsh legends faeries used to ride Corgis into battle.
Corgis were once used to herd cattle.
Queen Elizabeth II has owned over 30 Corgis in her lifetime!
The Great Dane is the tallest dog in the world, while the St. Bernard is the heaviest, weighing up to 120kg when fully-grown.
The Chihuahua is the smallest breed of dog in the world.
Dogs which live in the city will usually live longer than those who spend their lives in the countryside.
The world’s oldest dog lived to the grand old age of 29 years and 5 months.
The world’s smallest dog was a Yorkshire Terrier, which weighed just four ounces.
A dog was the first living creature to be sent into space.
Sometimes, a dog will chase its tail if it is suffering from fleas or anxiety.
Total cost of the Apollo 11 mission that first put a man on the moon was $25.4 billion. In today’s money, that’s around $135 billion.

Space pens were developed by a private pen company, that spent around $1 million developing a pen that would work in a vacuum, with zero gravity, while undergoing extremes of temperature, before selling 400 of them to the space agency at $2.95 each.
In 2013, a Russian cosmonaut called Pavel Vinogradov was the first human to pay his income taxes from space.
Various astronauts who have been on missions there claim that the moon smells of wet ashes, or spent gunpowder.
Snoopy, from the Peanuts comics, is the astronauts\' personal safety mascot.

Explorer 1, launched on Jan. 31, 1958, was the first artificial satellite sent into space by the United States. It orbited Earth every 115 minutes, and its cargo included a cosmic ray detector designed to measure the radiation environment in Earth\'s orbit.
Each space shuttle astronaut is allotted 3.8 pounds of food per day.
It takes six hours for a space shuttle, aboard a crawler-transporter, to make the trip from the vehicle assembly building to the launch pad preceding a mission.
A manned rocket reaches the moon in less time than it took a stagecoach to travel the length of England.

There is no set number of people in an astronaut candidate class; NASA selects its candidates on an as-needed basis. To even apply to be an astronaut, candidates must have completed 1,000 hours of flying time in a jet aircraft.
There is one spacecraft currently orbiting Jupiter called Juno.
Footprints left on the Moon won’t disappear as there is no wind.
A full NASA space suit costs $12,000,000.
On October 14, 1947, in the rocket powered Bell X-1, Capt. Charles E. Yeager flew faster than sound for the first time.
NASA became operational on October 1, 1958 -- one year after the Soviets launched Sputnik 1, the world\'s first artificial satellite.
The acronym "NASA" stands for National Aeronautics and Space Administration.
The Mercury, Gemini, and Apollo spacecraft landed in the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans when they returned to Earth.
Astronaut Alan Shepard, the first American in space, to pee right inside his space suit.
Astronauts lose one percent of their muscle mass and as much as two percent of their bone mass with every month that they spend in space.
Premature aging is now recognized as one of the side effects of space travel.
Cats are believed to be the only mammals who don’t taste sweetness.
Cats are nearsighted, but their peripheral vision and night vision are much better than that of humans.
Cats are supposed to have 18 toes (five toes on each front paw; four toes on each back paw).
Cats’ claws all curve downward, which means that they can’t climb down trees head-first. Instead, they have to back down the trunk.
Cats have an extra organ that allows them to taste scents on the air, which is why your cat stares at you with her mouth open from time to time.
Cats have whiskers on the backs of their front legs, as well.
Male cats are more likely to be left-pawed, while female cats are more likely to be right-pawed.
Cats live longer when they stay indoors.
Cats will refuse an unpalatable food to the point of starvation.
Despite popular belief, many cats are actually lactose intolerant.
A male cat is called a Tom. A female cat can be a Molly or a Queen.
The higher the fall, the more likely a cat is to survive it.
Cat brains are very similar to human brains.
President Abraham Lincoln was a bit of a crazy cat lady.
The first cat to take a trip to space was called Félicette.
If you think of yourself as a “cat person”, you’re among 11.5% of people in the world.
The record for the largest number of kittens in the same litter was 19.
Over her lifetime, a cat called Dusty had a total of 420 kittens.
The oldest known cat to give birth was 30 years old.
There are around 60 different recognized breeds of cats worldwide.
A ladybird might eat more than 5,000 insects in its lifetime!
Dragonflies have been on earth for 300 million years!
A bee’s wings beat 190 times a second, that’s 11,400 times a minute.
Caterpillars have 12 eyes!
One dung beetle can drag 1,141 times its weight – that’s like a human pulling six double-decker buses!
A single honeybee colony can produce around 100kg of honey each year – that’s 220 jars
Bulldog ants can leap seven times the length of their bodies!
Mosquitos are attracted to smelly feet!
Butterflies taste with their feet.
Grasshoppers existed before dinosaurs!
Beetles are the most biodiverse group of creatures.
There are 10 quadrillion ants on the planet at any given moment
Insects inhale oxygen and exhale carbon dioxide through holes called spiracles in their exoskeleton.
The dragonfly had a wingspan of 2.5 feet (290 million to 250 million years ago).
Most insects only live for a few days or weeks as reproducing adults
The egg laying queens of colonies can life for decades.
The meadow froghopper insect can jump more than 100 times its height (about 28 inches)
All bugs are insects, but not all insets are bugs
Houseflies find sugar with their feet, which are 10 million times more sensitive than human tongues.
Ticks can grow from the size of a grain of rice to the size of a marble.
Men were the first people to wear hee
Platform shoes used to be worn by Greek actors to signify status.
Sneakers got their name because their rubber soles do not make noise.
Your salary might determine the type of shoes you wear to work.
Audrey Hepburn could be credited with bringing loafers into style.
Dr. Martens were originally considered practical working men\'s boots for their air-cushioned soles.
Salvatore Ferragamo invented the wedge shoe when Italy was suffering from closed trade with other countries.
Havaianas are inspired by Japanese sandals.
Even though hardly any photos of him exist on the Internet, Jeffrey Campbell is a real person.
The red sole on Louboutins are inspired by an Andy Warhol drawing.
The first lady’s boot was designed for Queen Victoria in 1840.
The present fashion of shoes was introduced into England in 1633.
In the ninth and tenth centuries the greatest princes of Europe wore wooden shoes.
Slippers were in use before Shakespeare’s time, and were originally made “rights” and “lefts.”
Sneakers were first made in America in 1916. They were originally called keds.
The open-toed shoe became fashionable in the 1930s as a result of the new vogue for sunbathing.
Roger-Henri Vivier is credited with inventing (or at least re-popularizing) the stiletto heel in the 1950s.
The boots Neil Armstrong walked on the moon in are still floating around in space.
In Biblical times a sandal was given as a sign of an oath.
In Hungary the groom drinks a toast to his bride out of her wedding slipper.
The term "motorcycle" (or "motorrad" in German) was first used in 1894 by Hildebrand & Wolfmüller.
The longest distance a man rode a motorcycle in 24 hours was 3,256.5 km (2023.5 miles).
Japan once built a motorcycle that was indirectly powered by human waste. Its name is the Toilet Bike Neo, and its creator is high-end toilet manufacturer Toto
The first-ever Harley-Davidson motorcycle only went 25 mph (40 kph). It also had a single-cylinder engine that initially used an empty tomato can for its carburetor.
Sixty-eight percent of the female motorcyclists who died in crashes in 2016 were passengers, and their deaths represented 92 percent of the passenger deaths.
Suzuki originally began making weaving looms for Japan’s silk industry in the early part of the 1900s.
Dodge built and sold nine motorcycles with a Viper V-10 engine called the Dodge Tomahawk.
Modern sports bike tires don’t contain any actual rubber in them.
The longest distance for riding a motorcycle was 2,019.4 miles in a 24 hour period.
The first gas-powered motorcycle was invented by Gottlieb Daimler of Germany in 1885.
Helmet use was actually mandated following Colonel T.E. Lawrence‘s (Lawrence of Arabia) death in a motorcycle accident.
Honda’s CBR Stands For “Cross Beam Racer”
On average, motorcycles are about twice as fuel efficient as cars.
Honda is the most common brand stolen and Harley is the least.
The first Harley Davidson motorcycle, built in 1903, used a tomato soup can for a carburetor.
The first rider to ever go over 300 mph was Don Vesco in 1975, on a 1496cc Yamaha-engined streamliner.
When rounding corners, 75% of a bike\'\s grip comes from the front tire.
BMW is the only current major manufacturer to reject the use of telescopic forks on its big bikes.
The smallest functional motorcycle in the world is called Smalltoe, and Tom Wiberg built it.
Yamaha actually started as a piano manufacturer.
